content: A profitable restaurant group is a company or organization that owns and operates multiple successful restaurant businesses. These groups may have a variety of restaurant concepts under their umbrella, ranging from fast-casual to fine dining. The profitability of a restaurant group is determined by factors such as revenue, profit margin, customer satisfaction, and employee retention. Some examples of profitable restaurant groups include Darden Restaurants (owners of Olive Garden, LongHorn Steakhouse, and others), Bloomin' Brands (owners of Outback Steakhouse, Carrabba's Italian Grill, and others), and Union Square Hospitality Group (owners of Shake Shack, Gramercy Tavern, and others).
